msg: Transferred from the Adobe Open Source Subversion Repository

Reducing some of the event dispatching noise in the SDK.  Seeing pretty good results in our runtime performance tests and startup times... 5%-15% improvement over all.  This is about all we'll be able to commit to for Flex 4.0.  Added hasEventListener test before dispatching more of our lifecycle events.  Modified compiler binding code-gen to do the same.  Documented all public facing events where applicable to denote that they are no longer capturable by default.
Transferred from the Adobe Open Source Subversion Repository
Fix RTE in StyleManager cache code.
* Fix RTE in StyleManager cache code.
* Change _parent to parent so the set parent method is called for purposes of QA code coverage.
Is noteworthy for integration: yes Performance: fix RTE in last style manager performance fix.
Transferred from the Adobe Open Source Subversion Repository
Stop using the styleManager property in a constructor.
Cache inheriting styles. Also made static arrays in StyleManagerImpl per-instance.
Remove static StyleManager methods that were new to Flex 4 (qualifiedTypeSelectors property, getStyleDeclarations(), hasAdvancedSelectors(), hasPseudoCondition()).
Tests run: checkintests, containers/DividedBox, containers/form, components/ButtonBar, Managers/StyleManager, PerModuleStyleManager
Is noteworthy for integration: yes - StyleManager performance improvement
Transferred from the Adobe Open Source Subversion Repository

The code to remove style declarations from Subject was calling delete to remove the declaration. It removed the declaration but left an undefined entry in the Array because the array length was not changed. Later when the parent and child arrays are concatenated an undefined entry exists which causes the exception. Using splice() keeps the array length correct. Additionally, when there is only one entry in the array the entire Object from _subject is removed.

Alert.show() is called from a module and crashes because it is trying to use styles in the top-level app but the top-level app does not use Alert so the styles are not loaded. A work around would be to declare Alert in the top level application to draw in the needed styles. I made a fix in Alert so that work around is not needed.
Null pointer check for titleBarBackground. This fix avoids the RTE but the Alert has no background.
Add a module factory argument to Alert.show(). This is an alternative workaround to declaring Alert in the top-level application.
Tests run: checkintests, components/Alert, Managers/StyleManager, Managers/PopUpManager
Transferred from the Adobe Open Source Subversion Repository
Load a style module into the correct style manager.
•	Update loadStyleDeclarations() to have the same parameters as StyleManager.loadStyleDeclarations().
•	Pass the correct style manager instance to styleModule.setStyleDeclarations().
